H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3124.def: = a bird with a blue-gray color with a pinkish sheen to the neck feathers and a black tip on its tail; lives  in large colonies and eats mainly seeds; courts, mates, and has nests several times a year; nests on rock ledges; ◄ |iColumba livia|i*; ► used as food and for sacrifices; ≈ regarded as swift, docile, and innocent, but also as silly and senseless; associated with affection, fertility and sexuality because of its mating habits; the moaning sound this bird sometimes makes is associated with pain and suffering

H8145.def: = state in which a countable entity is the second in a range

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5210.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the {L:Tigris<SDBH:חִדֶּקֶל>}; ► built by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>} after the {L:flood<SDBH:מַבּוּל>}; ancient capital of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, preached against by the prophet {L:Jonah<SDBH:יֹונָה>}

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7150.def: = words that humans are to speak to others

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H4109.def: = the action by which a person moves or travels from one place to another

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H5210.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the {L:Tigris<SDBH:חִדֶּקֶל>}; ► built by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>} after the {L:flood<SDBH:מַבּוּל>}; ancient capital of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, preached against by the prophet {L:Jonah<SDBH:יֹונָה>}

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6685.def: = action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5060.def: = process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, whether deliberately or not

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H5210.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the {L:Tigris<SDBH:חִדֶּקֶל>}; ► built by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>} after the {L:flood<SDBH:מַבּוּל>}; ancient capital of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, preached against by the prophet {L:Jonah<SDBH:יֹונָה>}

H3678.def: = large elaborate seat used by people in a position of authority or wealth

H155.def: = state of being regarded with honor and respect

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5210.def: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the {L:Tigris<SDBH:חִדֶּקֶל>}; ► built by {L:Nimrod<SDBH:נִמְרֹד>} after the {L:flood<SDBH:מַבּוּל>}; ancient capital of {L:Assyria<SDBH:אַשּׁוּר>}, preached against by the prophet {L:Jonah<SDBH:יֹונָה>}

H2940.def: = the flavor characteristics of certain types of food

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H2938.def: = process by which the flavor of food is perceived, when eating

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H2394.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be strong and in a good state

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H2740.def: = process by which objects become extremely dry ► and therefore highly inflammable

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
